thread.title: Pacific field hockey clinches winning season
thread.title_full: Pacific field hockey clinches winning season

author: The Record
title: Pacific field hockey clinches winning season
text: Pacific field hockey clinches winning season Comment Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 12:01 AM By The Record Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 12:01 AM » Social News The Pacific field hockey team beat UC Davis 4-2 Sunday at home, clinching a guaranteed winning season for the first time since 2006. With two games remaining, against Cal and Stanford, the Tigers are 9-6 overall and 3-1 in the America East Conference. The Aggies are now 7-10 overall and 0-4 in conference play. Pacific has improved its record in each of the last three years. The Tigers' victory came on senior day, honoring Kristen Doting, Kelsey Gulledge, Malia Robertson, Nicole Laskosky and Hannah and Molly Bettencourt. Alicia Muiños, Rylee Comeau, Ali Campos and Savannah Burns each scored a goal for Pacific, which led 2-1 at halftime. Sidney Brooks, Hannah Tvergyak and Muiños added one assist each. Tigers goalie Laura Pujade made nine saves in 11 chances. Pacific has the week off, but hosts the annual alumni game at 2 p.m. Saturday. Pacific returns to America East competition against Cal at 2 p.m. Oct. 28, and finishes the regular season at 6 p.m. Oct. 30 at Stanford. HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL Millennium 18, Sierra Ridge/ROP 6 At West, the Falcons won their second consecutive Central California Athletic Alliance game, behind touchdowns from Josh Madding, Angel Deleon and Elijah Lawrence on Saturday in Tracy. Madding had a 33-yard touchdown reception from quarterback Jordan Johnson, Deleon had 10 carries for 54 yards and a TD and Lawrence had an interception return for a score. Millennium (3-4, 2-0 CCAA) posted four sacks against the Rams (2-4, 1-2), while Cody Lavagetto had two interceptions, and Lawrence, Solomon Daniel, Dorian Wright and Enrique Walten had one pick each. — All statistics via MaxPreps.com MEN'S SOCCER Pacific 0, Santa Clara 0 At Santa Clara, the Tigers snapped a seven-match losing streak, albeit with a tie, in a West Coast Conference battle at the Broncos' Stevens Stadium. Santa Clara (6-7-1, 1-1-1 WCC) out-shot Pacific (1-11-1, 0-2-1) twofold, at 16-8, but Tigers goalkeeper Curtis Goldsmith made five saves. Pacific hosts San Diego at 7:30 p.m. Oct. 30 at Knoles Field in Stockton. By The Record
